page.title: 14BEDALES SCHOOL, PETERSFIELD
page.content: Bedales school was started by J.H. Badly, who was the first Headmaster. It opened in January 1893 at a country house called "Bedales" near Haywards Heath in Sussex. In 1900 the school moved to Steep. Later the first and middle schools, Dunannie and Dunhurst, were opened. Bedales has been widely accepted as both a pioneer and leader in 'progressive education'. The curriculum is based on the idea of 'education for life'. Bedales is a co- educational school with about 390 boarders and 175 children who go daily. The Arts play an important part in the life of the school and it has a high reputation for music, drama and art and craft. There are good facilities for sport and science, and a fine library.
